decks.notes: This deck focuses on using artifacts and spells like Paradoxical Outcome to generate a large amount of mana and card advantage. It aims to set up a combo with cards like Time Vault and Manifold Key to take extra turns and win the game quickly. The deck also includes counterspells and disruption to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It utilizes the powerful synergy between artifacts and spells to control the game and win through a quick and efficient combo.

This deck aims to efficiently assemble the combo pieces needed to win the game in a single turn, utilizing cards like Doomsday, Thassa's Oracle, and various card draw spells to set up a winning sequence. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Duress to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck focuses on carefully managing resources and knowledge of the opponent's possible responses to execute the combo effectively and take the victory. It is a high-risk, high-reward strategy that requires precise timing and decision-making.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play quickly, while also utilizing control elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to disrupt opponents' strategies. It includes cards like Show and Tell and Tinker to further accelerate the deck and create powerful board states. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Atraxa, Grand Unifier provides additional threats and ways to control the game. The deck aims to control the game early on and overwhelm opponents with its big creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on generating insane amounts of mana using Mishra's Workshop, Mana Vault, Mana Crypt, and Moxen to cast Paradoxical Outcome, drawing a large number of cards and generating even more mana to eventually win the game through Time Vault or Tinker. Grim Monolith and Mana Crypt also provide additional mana acceleration to quickly set up the combo. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful win condition, utilizing cards like Force of Will and Trinisphere for protection and disruption.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to control the game through powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, while utilizing disruptive spells like Pithing Needle and Dress Down to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to draw cards and find key pieces like Time Vault and Manifold Key for a potential combo finish. With a mix of powerful artifacts, disruptive spells, and card draw, this deck aims to outmaneuver and outvalue its opponent in a Vintage 1 vs 1 match.

The focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition using powerful artifacts like Time Vault and Urza's Saga. The deck utilizes a mix of countermagic, card draw, and disruptive spells to control the board and outvalue the opponent. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion to provide additional value by recurring key threats or disruptive cards from the graveyard. The efficient use of mana rocks and cantrips allows the deck to maintain a consistent game plan while adapting to different matchups.

The deck focuses on assembling the pieces needed to cast Doomsday, which allows the player to set up a winning combo with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes various card draw and tutoring abilities to quickly find the necessary cards, as well as disruption and protection spells to prevent the opponent from interfering with the combo. The goal is to efficiently and effectively execute the Doomsday combo to win the game before the opponent can respond.

This deck focuses on quickly getting out Atraxa, Grand Unifier and other powerful creatures using Oath of Druids and Show and Tell. It also includes control elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck has powerful card advantage and mana acceleration with cards like Ancestral Recall and Black Lotus. It aims to control the game early on and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and spells. The inclusion of cards like Tinker and Bolas's Citadel allows for alternate win conditions if the Oath of Druids strategy is disrupted.

The deck focuses on utilizing hatebear creatures to disrupt opponent's plays while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By restricting the opponent's options with cards like Thalia and Chancellor of the Annex, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and gain an advantage. It also includes disruptive artifacts like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void to further hinder the opponent's spells. The deck combines aggressive creatures with hate cards to create a strong disruptive strategy that can overwhelm opponents in a Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and consistency through cards like Force of Will, Underground Sea, and Urza's Saga. The deck also includes powerful restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to gain even more advantage. The addition of Lurrus as a companion allows for additional value by bringing back key cards from the graveyard. Overall, the deck seeks to outlast opponents through disruption, card advantage, and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on using artifacts, especially artifacts with powerful abilities, to create an overwhelming advantage on the field. By combining cards that disrupt opponents' strategies with cards that generate massive card advantage, the deck aims to control the game and set up a winning combo. The Vintage 1 vs 1 format allows for the use of powerful restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Black Lotus to further accelerate the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble a game-winning combination of powerful artifacts and disrupt any opposing strategies.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids along with other control elements to cheat powerful creatures into play, such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also includes cards like Show and Tell and Flash to help quickly put threats into play. The deck is designed to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and other disruptive spells while setting up its own win conditions efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Boseiju, Who Endures adds versatility and resilience to the strategy. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while maintaining control of the game.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Lórien Revealed. It utilizes a mix of counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its own threats, while also leveraging Urza's Saga for additional value. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds a recurring threat and card advantage engine to the deck. With a strong balance of disruption, card advantage, and threats, this deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on using artifact cards to quickly assemble powerful combos and control the game. By using cards like Moxes, Mana Crypt, and Black Lotus to accelerate mana, along with disruptive cards like Force of Will and Nettlecyst, the deck can quickly establish a dominant board state. With access to powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, the deck aims to generate overwhelming advantages and overwhelm the opponent. The combination of efficient mana generation, disruptive elements, and powerful artifact synergies make this deck a formidable force in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Doomsday combo, utilizing cards like Dark Ritual and Demonic Tutor to set up a winning pile with Thassa's Oracle. It includes a variety of card draw and interaction spells to help protect the combo and ensure a smooth execution. By carefully managing resources and sequencing spells, the pilot can efficiently navigate through disruptions and opponents' counterplay to combo off and win the game in a decisive manner. The deck excels in manipulating the graveyard, hand, and library to achieve its ultimate goal of victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using cards like Force of Will, Flusterstorm, and Oko, Thief of Crowns while also utilizing Oath of Druids and Show and Tell to bring out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also includes various tutors and card draw spells to ensure consistency and efficiency in executing its game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Strip Mine further enhances the deck's ability to disrupt the opponent's strategy.
